info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 8:40PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Anderson, south central Pickens and southeastern Oconee Counties through 915 PM EST... At 840 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles south of Seneca, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Anderson, Clemson, Seneca, Northlake, Pendleton, Lake Hartwell, Townville, Sandy Springs and Oakway. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for development of a very brief, weak tornado. Be prepared to take immediate action if a tornado is sighted or a Tornado Warning is issued.
